Key Arguments: Classification of misinformation and disinformation is inherently contentious and subjective.
Government involvement in classifying information as misinformation or disinformation is antidemocratic and resembles totalitarianism.
Existing laws already cover issues like defamation, bullying, and harassment, making new legislation unnecessary.
The proposed legislation could lead to censorship and suppression of dissenting views.
The bill could exacerbate societal issues and increase public distrust.
Notable Quotes: Classification of anything as misinformation or disinformation is inherently contentious.
Normalised government imposition of contention is the essence of totalitarianism.
Nothing essentially antidemocratic should be law in Australia.
The entire issue intended to be addressed by this Bill happens to boil down to the question of whether censorship and/or dogmatism are better than exposure to concepts they are rallied against.
